救急救命士による12誘導心電図電送の役割
paper_title.en: The Role of 12-Lead Electrocardiography Transmitted via Telephone from an Emergency Life-Saving Technician.

description.ja: 非外傷性に胸部不快感を訴えている患者の12誘導心電図を院外で記録し電話で電送できれば,患者のトリアージに役立つと考え検討した。救急救命士は現着時に患者の病状が安定していることを確認し,承諾を得たあと救命指導医に電話で連絡した。指導医が適応ありと判定した205例を対象として,救命士は心電図を救急車内で記録した。心電図はアナログからデジタルへ変換され,自動解析後に携帯電話にて電送された(NEC社製)。その心電図は指導医の待機する消防指令センターでプリントアウトされた。その結果,2例は電送不能で2例は搬送を拒否したため,残る201例では心電図の記録開始から現場出発まで平均10.5±7.8分を要した。指導医は各症例で主訴と心電図所見より初期診断し,患者のトリアージを行った。搬送した医療機関での最終診断は狭心症36例,急性心筋梗塞27例,心不全23例,不整脈21例であり,全体の53.2%を心疾患が占めた。心電図自動解析の結果は狭心症例では38.9%がST. T波異常で,27.8%が不整脈であった。急性心筋梗塞例では40.7%がST. T波異常で,14.8%でしか急性心筋梗塞と診断できなかった。心不全例では30.4%がST. T波異常で,26.1%が不整脈であった。しかし不整脈例では52.4%を不整脈と診断できた。指導医による初期診断の精度(感度と陽性適中率)を最終診断より顧みると,狭心症例では50.0%と54.5%,急性心筋梗塞例では74.1%と64.5%,心不全例では34.8%と61.5%,不整脈例では66.7%と58.3%であった。すなわち,急性心筋梗塞例と不整脈例とでは有意差を認めなかったが,急性心筋梗塞例の初期診断精度は,1誘導心電図電送でも診断可能とされる不整脈例より良好であった。以上より,今後より多くの心疾患患者で12誘導心電図電送が活用されるには,心電図記録開始から現場出発までの時間を短縮し,急性心筋梗塞患者での診断精度向上に向けての自動解析ソフトの更新が必要と思われた。
description.en: The purpose of this study was to show the utility of prehospital 12-lead electrocardiography (ECG) transmitted from an emergency life-saving technician (ELT) during the triage of patients with non-traumatic chest discomfort. Once the ELT arrived at the field, the patient's condition was confirmed to be stable. After an informed consent was obtained, the ELT would call a life-saving medical adviser at the fire information center to determine if the patient was suitable for the study. Two-hundred and five patients were enrolled, and their prehospital ECGs were recorded by the ELT in the ambulance. An analog to digital conversion was performed using a compact ECG device (NEC Ltd.) that was connected via modem link to a cellular telephone. The digitized ECG was analyzed by the machine according to the NEC algorithm and transmitted to another ECG device in the information center with a printout. Consequently, the average time from the start of ECG recording to the ambulance departure was 10.5±7.8 minutes in 201 cases, although the ECGs of two cases could not be transmitted and two other cases refused to be transported. The life-saving medical adviser made an initial diagnosis based on the chief complaint and ECG findings, and decided to which hospital the patient should be transported. After hospital admission, 53.2% of the patients were diagnosed as having cardiac diseases, including 36 cases of angina pectoris (AP), 27 cases of acute myocardial infarction (AMI), 23 cases of heart failure (HF) and 21 cases of arrhythmia (AR). The major ECG findings of the computer analyses were ST-T wave abnormality (38.9%) and arrhythmia (27.8%) in AP, ST-T wave abnormality (40.7%) and acute myocardial infarction (14.8%) in AMI, ST-T wave abnormality (30.4%) and arrhythmia (26.1%) in HF, and arrhythmia (52.4%) in AR. When the accuracy of the initial and final diagnosis were compared retrospectively, the sensitivity and positive predictive values were 50.0% and 54.5% for AP, 74.1% and 64.5% for AMI, 34.8% and 61.5% for HF, 66.7% and 58.3% for AR, respectively. There were no statistically significant differences between AMI and AR, but the diagnostic accuracy of AMI was better than that of AR, which can be diagnosed using single-lead telemetry. Therefore, when this system is applied on a large scale of cardiac patients, efforts to reduce the time between ECG recording and ambulance departure must be made, and the ECG computer software should be revised to improve the diagnostic accuracy of AMI.
